TRANSIT OF FARMING REQUISITES.
During the week quantities of agricultural machinery and implements including motor ploughs, ploughs, corn drills, potato diggers, hay-clevators; manure distributors and quantities of Basic Slag and Sulphate of Ammonia arrived at the Port of Dublin and consignments of a similar nature were forwarded from Dublin ?ailway stations.
Inquiries made at centres in Connaught went to show that the arrangements made by the Railway Companies in connection with the delivery of consignments of farming requisites were satisfactory.
MAINTENANCE OF LIVE STU?K
During the period from 25th September to 1st October, inclusive; 869 applications for licences to slaughter or export under the Order relating to breeding sows were received by the Department and 765 licences were issued. During the same period 46 applications for licences to export horses under the Horses (Prohibition of Exportation from Ireland) Order, were received, and 77 licences (relating in a proportion of cases to earlier applications) were issued.
